Metadata.title: LAPODEV - Laboratory of Politics and Development
Metadata.description: Research center at the University of Kinshasa (UNIKIN) specialized in politics, development, governance and consultancy.

hero.subtitle: Laboratory of Political Anthropology, Development and Vulnerability Analysis
hero.description: An interface between the academic world and society for the service of Man and Congolese society.

Footer.description: The Laboratory of Politics and Development (LAPODEV) is a research and consultancy structure of the University of Kinshasa.
Footer.address: Local C30/B11, Bloc C/ Cave du Home 30, UNIKIN, B.P. 127, Kinshasa XI, DRC

AboutPage.title: Who are we?
AboutPage.subtitle: A pole of excellence in the service of Man and society

intro.title: Identity and Social Purpose
intro.content: LAPODEV is a cutting-edge research center in human and social sciences positioned as an interface between the academic world and society. It is a center of excellence that brings together, on a voluntary basis, teacher-researchers, researchers and experts from different disciplinary backgrounds to serve humanity and society. The center enjoys administrative and financial autonomy and independence.
intro.social_object: LAPODEV's social object is fundamental research and action research from an interdisciplinary / multidisciplinary and holistic perspective.

values.title: Our Values & Missions
values.content: The Center's fundamental values are Excellence, Intellectual Honesty and Transparency.

objectives.title: Our Objectives
objectives.intro: To achieve its social object, LAPODEV sets the following objectives:

GovernancePage.title: Governance
GovernancePage.subtitle: An organized structure for scientific excellence

general_assembly.title: General Assembly
general_assembly.content: The General Assembly is the supreme body of LAPODEV. It defines the general policy, approves research programs and elects members of the various management bodies. It ensures the cohesion and integrity of the laboratory's vision.

politics.title: Political Domain
politics.subtitle: Homo politicus - Elucidation of the political object
politics.intro: Political anthropology at LAPODEV explores the forms and foundations of power in contemporary societies.

concepts.polity: Reflection on the political community, identities and living together.
concepts.politics: Analysis of processes, power struggles and local political life.
concepts.policy: Study of public policies, their implementation and impact.

goals: Elucidate the political object in its historical and contemporary forms
Analyze the metamorphoses of politics and democracy
Study interactions between formal and informal institutions
Explore dynamics of citizenship and participation
Understand local and national governance logics

development.title: Development Anthropology
development.intro: Critical analysis of social change processes and development interventions.
development.quote: Political and development anthropology offers a unique perspective for analyzing interactions between political institutions, social actors and development processes.
goals: Study social impact of projects and programs
Evaluate sustainability and inclusivity of interventions
Submit approaches based on sociocultural realities

vulnerabilities.title: Vulnerability Analysis
vulnerabilities.intro: Study of precaritization processes and social exclusion mechanisms.

groups.handicap_hiv_lgbt: People living with disabilities, HIV or discrimination

goals: Evaluate effectiveness of social protection policies

axes.title: Research Axes & Themes
axes.description: Ten axes and research themes on which the Center's researchers work.

consultancy.title: Consultancy
consultancy.description: LAPODEV offers specialized consultancy services to national and international organizations.
items: Development projects and programs, humanitarian aid
Public policies and political governance, legal advice
Surveys, polls and field data analysis

human_resources.title: Human Resources
human_resources.subtitle: Our Scientific Capital
human_resources.description: An interdisciplinary community of researchers committed to social progress.

modal.default_bio: Discover this member's profile by downloading their full dossier. This researcher is actively involved in LAPODEV projects.

bios.indeka: Joseph Indeka Nkoso is a Full Professor in the Department of Anthropology and Director of LAPODEV. Aggregated in history, he holds a PhD in Political and Social Sciences from the Université Libre de Bruxelles. His research reconciles multidisciplinarity, scale variation, and long duration.
bios.kavira: PhD in Systematics from the Faculté Universitaire de Théologie Protestante de Bruxelles. Specialist in Gender Studies. Author of several articles and researcher at LAPODEV.

declaration.content: I hereby declare my wish to become a member of LAPODEV. I have taken note of the rights and duties of LAPODEV members, and agree to pay my annual fee as fixed by the General Assembly.
declaration.agree: I accept the membership terms and conditions
